Package ZuulBad

Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
ZuulBad.Inventory
public class Inventory
extends java.lang.Object
This class handles the inventory of the player. It creates an instance of the class Items and provides methods the player can call to interact with items stored in backpack (e.g. drop, eat).
Version:
1.0
Author:
Sarah Engelmayer

    javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty backpackWeight

    Inventory()

  • Property Details

    • backpackWeight

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty backpackWeightProperty
      A Getter for the property variable for the current weight of the backpack. It is necessary for the implementation of the according Listener (declared in class 'Game').

  • Field Details

    • maxWeight

      private int maxWeight
      specifies the maximum permissible weight of the backpack.

    • currentWeight

      private javafx.beans.property.SimpleIntegerProperty currentWeight
      specifies the current weight of the backpack.

    • content

      private Items content
      the current content of the backpack.

  • Constructor Details

    • Inventory

      public Inventory()
      initializes the variables 'content' and 'currentWeight' and sets the maximum portable weight to a value depending on the level of difficulty. If level 'Easy' is chosen then maximum portable weight is 20. If level 'Medium' is chosen then maximum portable weight is 15. If level 'Heavy' is chosen then maximum portable weight is 10.

  • Method Details

    • backpackWeightProperty

      public javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty backpackWeightProperty()
      A Getter for the property variable for the current weight of the backpack. It is necessary for the implementation of the according Listener (declared in class 'Game').

    • addItemToBackpack

      public void addItemToBackpack​(Item... items)
      One or more items are put into the backpack. The weight of the item(s) is added to the weight of the backpack.
      Parameters:
      items - the items that should be put in the backpack.

    • removeItem

      public boolean removeItem​(Item item)
      An item is removed from the backpack. If the backpack contains the specified item, it will be removed and the weight of the backpack decreased.
      Parameters:
      item - The item that should be removed from the backpack
      Returns:
      'true' if the item was removed from the backpack, 'false' if the item was not removed

    • removeWeapon

      public void removeWeapon()
      An arbitrary weapon is removed from the backpack. If there is no weapon in the backpack, nothing happens.

    • contains

      public boolean contains​(Item specificitem)
      Answers the question if a specified item is in the backpack or not.
      Parameters:
      specificitem - The item about which we want to know if it is in the backpack or not.
      Returns:
      'true' if the backpack contains the item, 'false' if not.

    • containsFood

      public boolean containsFood​(java.lang.String foodName)
      Answers the question if a specified food is in the backpack or not.
      Parameters:
      foodName - the food about which we want to know if it is in the backpack or not.
      Returns:
      'true' if the backpack contains the food, 'false' if not.

    • containsWeapon

      public boolean containsWeapon()
      Answers the question if the backpack contains an arbitrary weapon or not.
      Returns:
      'true' if the backpack contains a weapon, 'false' if not.

    • getListOfContent

      public java.lang.String getListOfContent()
      Provides a string that lists all the items in backpack at the moment.
      Returns:
      the String that lists all the items in backpack at the moment.

    • setMaxWeight

      public final void setMaxWeight​(int maxWeight)
      A Setter for the maximum portable weight of the backpack. It is used after the difficulty level is selected.
      Parameters:
      maxWeight - the value of the weight to which the maximum weight should be set

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull​(int itemWeight)
      Answers the question if another item can be put into the backpack or if this would exceed the maximum portable weight of the backpack.
      Parameters:
      itemWeight - the weight of the item that should be put into the backpack.
      Returns:
      'false' if the item can be put into the backpack, 'true' if not.

    • getRemainingFreeWeight

      public int getRemainingFreeWeight()
      provides the weight which the backpack could still take, so to say the 'free weight'.
      Returns:
      the value of the weight that is still free

    • getMaxWeight

      public int getMaxWeight()
      A Getter for the maximum portable weight of the backpack
      Returns:
      the maximum portable weight of the backpack
